store_info.name: Bookshop
store_info.description: Your local haven to find the perfect accessory for your performative-reading-Instagram-photodump.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy classic about Bilbo's adventures.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel of racial injustice in the Deep South.

books.title: The Name of the Wind
books.author: Patrick Rothfuss
books.description: Kvothe's journey in a richly woven world.

books.title: The Waves
books.author: Virginia Woolf
books.description: A stream-of-consciousness novel following six friends from childhood to old age.

books.title: Book of Disquiet
books.author: Fernando Pessoa
books.description: An introspective collection of fragments and observations by Bernardo Soares.

books.title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
books.author: Ottessa Moshfegh
books.description: A darkly comic novel about a year-long experiment in self-induced hibernation.

books.title: The Hour of the Star
books.author: Clarice Lispector
books.description: A meditation on poverty and identity through the eyes of a young Brazilian girl.

books.title: Demian
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.description: A coming-of-age tale exploring the dualities of human nature.

books.title: No Longer Human
books.author: Osamu Dazai
books.description: A haunting portrayal of alienation and despair.

books.title: Flowers of Evil
books.author: Charles Baudelaire
books.description: A landmark 19th-century collection exploring beauty, decadence, and sin.

books.title: A Season in Hell
books.author: Arthur Rimbaud
books.description: An experimental poetic manifesto on suffering and transcendence.

books.title: The Idiot
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: “The Idiot” by Dostoevsky follows Prince Myshkin, a guileless and compassionate young man whose Christ-like innocence both illuminates and ultimately unravels the moral corruption of St. Petersburg society.
